Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin (Small tin)”
Reviews.Author: popeyeNqy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ibis Novena during September 2011 for the Singapore Grand Prix race weekend. The hotel is located out of the centre of town, with the nearest MRT station located at Novena. The walk from the station is about 10 minutes past the hospital, with the hotel located on the left hand side at the bottom of Irrawaddy road, on the junction of Balistier Road. If using a taxi it is better to mention Balistier road, as the taxi's we used didn't have a clue where Irrawaddy road was. As Singapore has an obsession with regulation, maybe they should insist all taxi's should have SATNAV linked to their meters. The rooms were basic, comfortable and clean and served the purpose of a bed for the night and had a good shower. The rooms are a little small and would be frustrating if you spent a lot of time in them, which we didn't. Internet access was good with free wifi. Staff were polite and helpful and delivered on everything we asked (sort aircon and book taxis). Singapore is an expensive city and we probably stayed at the most expensive time of year. The room rate we paid was about UK £100 a night, and was cheaper to book through the TRIVAGO website rather than the IBIS website. Hope this helps, Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, clean but not great value”
Reviews.Author: travellingnickers
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a layover for the night. Not much in the near vicinity during the evening but in the day there is a shopping centre with a reasonable food court in walking distance. The hotel is quite new and so is clean and well maintained but the rooms are very small - 2 of us struggled to fit in with 2 cases - so don't plan on doing heaps of shopping!

Reviews.Title: “6 nights at Ibis Novena”
Reviews.Author: Dumont D
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel due to its proximity to the National Skin Center. Spent 6 nights with them. Pros: 1) 1-3 min walk to the nearest bus stop (very convenient) 2) Clean, ample-sized, cold room 3) Modern design 4) Early check-in possible 5) Front desk staff are helpful 6) Free in room wi-fi (speed depends on the time) 7) You can take the bust to the MRT station from which you can get anywhere you like or walk 15-20 mins going there. Warning, it's very hot in SG so if you want to arrive to your destination fresh, I suggest you take the bus. Public transport is quite cheap. Cons: 1) Bathroom quite small but do-able 2) Can't walk to the nearest tourist attraction if you're in SG for leisure 3) Price a little expensive for it's location but a lot of hotels in SG are more expensive 4) Breakfast is okay for 2 days but for a week long, you would rather eat somewhere else. So I suggest just take your breakfast outside. 5) The have the world's smallest fridge/cooler. But it can fit four 500ml bottles of water. 6) Water is not free. It would've been nice if they provided some considering the price of the hotel. I'll recommend it if you need to do something within Novena area but not if you're here for a vacation most especially if you're first timers. The hotel is fairly new (1 year old I think). If you don't mind commuting to different places, then you can probably stay here. :)

Reviews.Title: “Basic room with poor soundproof.”
Reviews.Author: morinaga
Reviews.Content: The nearest MRT stn to ibis Novena is at Novena Stn.It take you at least 10mins walk from stn with lots of up and down slops route along Irrawaddy Road. My first impression of the hotel is that the lobby is small without much aircon and luggages were kept all over the lobby.I got a 2 single beds room located at 10 floor(highest floor).There are 3 new lifts available, travel at a slow speed.My room was right at the corner,room was slighly spacious compare with other buget htl.There is not even any city view from my rm as is block by another higher appartment which is very close to the htl.The htl provide free strong Wifi,32inch LCD TV,coffee/tea maker and a tiny little fridge(just big enough for ONLY 2 small bottle of water) The bath room was tiny without bath tub and some basic of toiletries.I would like to highlight is that there is not even a single hander for you to hand your towel or clothes inside the bath rm. My nightmare came when about to sleep. The soundproof of the room was horrible,I heard ppl chattering,slaming the door etc.Early in the morning I even heard ppl rushing for chk out.I can hardly have any slp during the night. The breakfast was "just OK'' which cost SGD$15++,they serve about 7 hot dishes (include plain steamed rice and porridge)which taste "so so",fruits,beverages and pastries.Their worse dish is their fried noodle which taste cold n soggy other then that other dishes still acceptable.Overall I prefer to a cup of hot cafe latte serve with hot toast bread. Even ibis are classified as buget hotel but is still cost about $220 for my one night stay.If got other choice with this type of hotel rate in SG I would never choose ibis Novena.Located wise I don't find it convenient even the htl provide hourly(not every hr) free shuttle service to Novena stn or even Orchard but you hardly get a chance to reserve a seat as the "bus" only take up 10 pax per trip.I tried to reserve the day before but from 10-12pm were all fully book.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accommodation at Budget Price”
Reviews.Author: Darra A
Reviews.Content: On arrival, made to feel welcome and we were offered refreshing cold dinks while checking in. Staff were very friendly and eager to please, nothing was too much trouble. Room was a good size and well appointed. Also had free WiFi which really is a must these days. Nice restaurant with excellent meals. Plenty to choose from at breakfast buffet. Located away from Singapore CBD but there are busses going past. MRT station is a bit of a hike to get to but taxis are cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: aero_dude
Reviews.Content: Close to novena station. Basic rooms. Food at the restaurant is very good!

Reviews.Title: “A little out of the way but OK”
Reviews.Author: JEmmanuelLasPinas
Reviews.Content: Just needed a clean, comfortable bed for a couple nights. I got it. The location is walking distance to the Novena MRT. There is a small shopping center close by and a few places to eat as well. Location is not central - airport taxi didn't know where it was. Ok if you are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected!”
Reviews.Author: aycs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ibis Hotel in Novena for 19 nights and had a very enjoyable stay. For starters, the hotel is a quick trip up the expressway from the airport, although be mindful that our taxi driver did get lost and tried to drop us off at the wrong hotel up the road. Once we arrived, we were given a no fuss early check in at 8.30am as they had a room available and we had just flown a red-eye flight in. Very nice. Although we did not use too many services of the hotel, we did ask for a few things from housekeeping during our stay - trivial stuff like more toilet paper or an extra hand towel, because they weren't replaced or had been taken away after they had cleaned the room. The hotel has a policy that says that if you have a problem, they'll fix in 15 minutes and the one time we called the front desk with a request (of more toilet paper) it took about half an hour. No problem right, except somebody (and I won't name names) was sitting on the toilet and the paper hadn't been replenished, nor a spare roll left. Also, do not leave your spare door card in the power slot if you get your room cleaned because housekeeping will take it away and you'll be left with one door card. You also need your card to access the elevators up. The hotel also offers a free shuttle van that holds eight people and can take you to Novena MRT or Orchard Road. It leaves the hotel (and the other 2 locations) at set times a couple of times a day, which is great when it's raining. But sometimes the van runs late and you either wait, walk or catch a bus or taxi. The hotel offers free wifi, which is great, unless you're using it during peak times, which is basically in the evenings. During those times we found wifi very, very slow. But there are 2 computers downstairs in the lobby if there's anything you need to quickly check online. But if you are loitering around the hotel lobby, be careful of the frequent drop of condensation that falls from the air-con vents above. I think they were fixing this during our stay, but by the time we checked out, there were still small pools of water on the floor around the hotel lobby. We also made a phone call to a local mobile phone and spoke for over 15 minutes and the bill when checking out was $1. We had a room on the 4th floor, facing outwards onto Balestier Road. Not much of a view unless you like looking at petrol stations or lighting and bathroom shops. The rooms were very clean and simple, all we really needed since we were out from 9am and only returned very late in the evenings to shower, watch a bit of TV and sleep. There are 16 TV channels with several in other Asian languages, CNN, News Asia, an Aussie channel, 2 sport channels and also a cartoon channel. There's also the typical Ibis info channel, which lists the daily room cost (we saw it fluctuate from as low as $148++ to $228++ during our stay, and even saw them adjusting it onscreen whilst we sat there watching TV. They also have the weather, which wasn't updated for several days at times and they also list their exchange rate. We slept well every night and although the bed was a little hard and the pillows a little too high for our tastes, the room was very quiet. We could hardly hear any outside traffic from our 4th floor room, and only the odd scraping of a chair on the floorboards from above now and them. Fair enough we heard the odd person slamming their door shut or talking loudly in the hallway, and even kids running past, but that's not the fault of the hotel and during our long stay, it was far and few between. The room has a small shoe box fridge that will chill 2 small bottles of water and tetra pack sized drinks overnight. Just don't do what I did and fill it with 12 tetra pack drinks because it took 3 days to even cool down. Leave 5 or 6 small drinks or 2 600ml bottles in there and they'll chill overnight. Air conditioning was maybe a little noisy, but not annoying, but the range of temperatures and fan speed and reaction time allowed us to cool or warm the room quickly and easily. After storing 2 suitcases in the room, one on the large desk and the other on a cushioned seat, it only left the desk chair or the bed to lounge around on, which wasn't a problem. The bathroom is a little tight which means you'll have to brush you teeth one at a time in there. And when you're showering, be careful not to knock the shower lever and accidentally turn it off as you move around in your triangular shower cubicle. At least it's a glass screen so you don't have to put up with shower curtains molesting you whilst you wash. One of the big draw cards of the hotel is it's location on Balestier Road. The MRT is a brisk 10 minute uphill and downhill, mostly covered walk. But if you're feeling lazy and didn't take the shuttle van, you can catch the 131 or the 21 bus 3 stops to the station (and shopping centre). The bus stop is only around the corner from the hotel and buses run very frequently. You also have the option of catching a bus to your destination instead and not worrying about the train. All bus shelters have a list of the buses and their routes on panels (all which remain graffiti and vandalism free). There are many local eateries down the road from the hotel, on both sides of the road, plus a 7Eleven only a couple of hundred meters away. There are a few local favorite eateries within walking distance from Ibis, including a couple of places that boasts to have the best chicken rice, and another that boasts to have the best durian in Singapore. And since you can't take durian on the bus, train, taxi and/or your hotel, what better place to try it. Taxis are so common around the area because of the nearby hospitals and the business of Balestier Road, so be careful not to scratch your head as all the passing taxi drivers will veer over to you thinking that you're flagging them down. Be aware that there is a new building (when isn't there a new building being constructed) being built across the road and you can hear a bit of that noise if you're in your room during the day. If you're a non-smoker, I'd avoid the 3rd floor. If you are, I'd ask for the 3rd floor. There is an outdoor smoking 'room' located between rooms 328 and 332 and I'd imagine that smoke will inadvertently drift into the hall and possibly into your room. I saw one gentleman standing with his foot holding the smoking room door ajar, while he happily smoked in the hallway on level 3 (you can see because there are windows on level 4 that look down into the smoking room). Ibis Novena is a hotel we would happily stay again - if the price was right. Considering the length of time we stayed, we had a very comfortable and enjoyable stay. The hotel caters well for the solo traveler, families and friends (we had more family fly in and join us halfway through our stay taking up another 4 rooms, and only one didn't end up on the same floor as us). It's location allows you to experience a bit of the heartlands of Singapore (except for the expats and their families living around the area), with all the main tourist haunts only a quick bus, MRT or taxi ride away.

Reviews.Title: “NOISY HOTEL :(”
Reviews.Author: globalinvest
Reviews.Content: I looked forward to staying at the Novena Ibis b/c it was newly built & a 5 min walk to the MRT Novena but it turned out to be such a HUGE disappointment!! I had to change my room THREE times just to get a decent night's sleep!! !! Though the management tried to accommodate me to a much quieter room it wasn't really their fault but the major fault of the hotel's shoddy POOR sound proofing construction along w/visitors especially families w/children!! If you stay in this hotel in Dec/Jan it will be full of families on holiday for sure. My room was next to a family who booked two rooms & their kids were letting the doors close in a banging way back & forth, it was horrible! I had to confront the family. In the end I had to move only to discover the 2nd room move to be just the same, hearing people talk loudly n walk in the hallways! The manager later moved me to a higher floor & it was better but still that was the 3rd move!! I have never paid a hotel in where I had to move 3 FREAKIN TIMES!! The next time I will try the Oasia Hotel which is literally next to the MRT Novena.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but good location”
Reviews.Author: kiranb
Reviews.Content: This is a typical Ibis property... good and clean - with functional rooms (quite small really), average service and decent location. Not much to complain - though price is quite expensive for an Ibis... guess its because it is in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean enough, location is good, long distance to Novena MRT, and a lot of good food around. The only thing is they don't provide water for drink in the room. I think water is important whenever we stay in one place. Maybe they should inform if we can use water from water tap for drink.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Stuartessaouira
Reviews.Content: Pretty good value for Singapore. Decent sized rooms. Good breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Affordable hotel; but far from MRT”
Reviews.Author: joy101
Reviews.Content: Stayed here when it was newly opened. The location is not so good.. It's around a 10-15 minute walk to the Novena MRT.. which feels like forever when you are already tired :) not to mention the walk is a bit uphill and not-so-scenic. You can take a taxi but we all know it's much cheaper and more convenient to go around Singapore via MRT. No 7-11's nearby, convenience stores, groceries, malls, restaurants. Hotel was ok. Room is very small. Our toilet looked dirty on our first night and we were told by the housekeeping it's rust. Which is weird for a new hotel. Housekeeping was pretty rude also when we asked for assistance on the toilet issue. Free breakfast is included and wifi so those are the good parts :)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Mish N
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean, new and quite spacious. Got an excellent discount using the Singapore stop-over deals with SIA. Stay included free transfer to the airport on our departure from the hotel. The late check-out option was useful too as we had a midnight flight. The unlimited wi-fi offered to hotel guests definitely handy as other hotels usually charge for this facility. Location was ok, the MRT Novena station was approx a 10min walk but there is a shuttle bus run by the hotel during the day that can drop you at either the Novena MRT station or near Orchard road which was convenient. There are also food places around the corner (within walking distance) and Newton Circus is only one MRT stop away. Overall friendly staff and great facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new Ibis, location a bit suboptimal, but clean and good”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller201000
Reviews.Content: Alright, maybe my review gets a slightly better rating than it should, but I was able to snatch the Ibis for just 108S$ - around 40% off the regular rate - so I was rather happy with everything. The property is brand new. It's quite a walk from the MRT, especially with luggage. Better take the bus there (check on gothere.sg how to take the bus) which just drives at the main road. So, if you get there with Taxi/Bus, it's actually quite well located. Plenty of bus lines going to all major places downtown, so if you're good on taking public transport, it will save you quite some money. The room is clean, just Ibis standard, the bathroom, everything works as expected. Good TV, good amount of channels. Really can't complain about anything regarding the rooms. New, clean, good wooden ground. Checkin and Checkout worked fine as well, pre-pay rate was in the system, my reservation found, checkout very quickly. At night, there are a few shops around the hotel (7-11) - so you can get anything you want 24hrs, and Newton Hawker center which is open like till 4am is also not too far away (short taxi hop or 20min walk or so.. ) All in all, the hotel does provide whats advertised, not more, not less. Go for it, if you can secure a good deal on the rate and only want basic, clean services.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly place and good for the Traveller”
Reviews.Author: RALFBKK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here right before the Chinese New Year and everyone was so friendly and in holiday mood. The Hotel Lobby and the Restaurant are really nice and the rooms are very IBIS, which I did not mind either. Great working desk with Flat Screen TV and lots of channels. Problem with the Hotel is the location. First morning, not really knowing where I was, I had to go down to Clarke Quay and let me tell you getting a cab was real problem. I waited about 20 mins on the curb for a cab to show up and to stop. Trip was 15$ which made me realize how off I was from the center. The night later I took the MRT to Novena and found that rather comfortable as the walk back to the hotel was refreshing and interesting (about 15mins). Novena Mall has a lot to offer, including a supermarket and many restaurants. Breakfast at the Hotel was nice and very western with everything regular available. For the business traveller who looks after his expenses this is a good place to spent a few nights in Singapore. And yes, Internet at the room was free and fast. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and clean hotel for couple of days”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location is not very good, but MTR (Novena) is in walking distance. Rooms a quite big for Singapore and price is very good. But all places of interest is away from this hotel, wich was not a big deal for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good for short stay”
Reviews.Author: Frozensage
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights as the first leg of our three weeks Asia holiday/shopping/tour. Small cosy hotel located on a corner block land. Definitely not as impressive as the Ibis in Bencoolen (bugis) but clean and simple nevertheless, also costing $20 cheaper p/n. The rooms were of generous size, large bed, enough for two adults with 2 medium size bag. The bathroom can accommodate for one adult at a time. Very new fit out. The nearest MRT (train) station is located 5-10 minutes away, up the hill at the bottom of the Novena shopping mall. This could get annoying after afew trips. The shopping mall has alot of cafe and restaurants at an affordable (not super cheap) price. Not the type of mall I would do alot of (cloth) shopping but definitely good for buying breakfast or snack for whilst at the hotel. There's also an money exchange located at the main entrance to the shopping mall. Alot of residential apartments and foot traffic around this area so you definitely would not feel unsafe whilst walking up and down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, location only not bad”
Reviews.Author: Vaskez
Reviews.Content: Pros: + Bed was comfortable, room was a good size + Shower/bathroom in general were good + Staff were extremely helpful and polite. I've never been to a hotel with such polite staff. Almost suck-up polite. But other people in Singapore were also very polite, so I guess this must be a Singapore thing. + I like that the maids actually pay attention to your "instructions" here - when you leave the Do Not Disturb sign out, they don't come into your room while you're gone, like at some other hotels. When you don't leave it out, they do clean your room - this is what you'd normally expect but I've seen many hotels where they ignore your wishes on this. + Breakfast was generally very good, with a good choice of both asian and european foods, although a surprising omission which I missed every morning is cheese, simply couldn't find any in the breakfast buffet - not a big deal, just thought I'd mention it + the hotel is next to a busy main road - Ballestier Road - which has many food courts/places to eat out and also a mall nearby Neutral - I'd say the location is not ideal, as it is too far to walk into the city centre, but the hotel is 10 minutes walk from the nearest Metro station, which makes up for it, and the Metro is relatively cheap and quick to get you into town or to any other major attraction. - if you are prepared to walk 25-30 minutes you can even get into Little India on foot Cons: - I did have one problem with my room, which is that the power outlets were dodgy. They kept turning themselves off if I plugged something in - although the bathroom outlet was on a separate circuit so I did manage to charge my laptop as that circuit seemed less dodgy. Initially I did tell the staff, who immediately sent someone up, all he needed to do was flip the main fuse switch off and on again to get the power back, but it kept happening again/power going off, no matter how many times I flipped the main fuse switch, so in the end I just left it and charged my phone/laptop in the bathroom. Note that this did not affect the lights as they are luckily also on a separate circuit. - For the price of the hotel I would've expected maybe a small swimming pool, but there was none

Reviews.Title: “Good but expensive Ibis”
Reviews.Author: uprightM
Reviews.Content: Not far from Novena MRT station, but be carefull if you have bags: there's a hill to climb between the hotel and the MRT station. Following Ibis international standards, hotel itself is brand new, with nice, big windows that are very good if your room faces the street, or useless if it faces another room. Despite big, windows have good sound isolation, so we could have a silent night to sleep (the end of the construction works of the new building next door definitely contributed to a quieter night too). Staff was always helpfull when we asked for something. Like many other places in Singapore, prices were above Ibis intrnational average, but it concerns to the city, not to the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. It have great location so peaceful quietly but convenient to go any where. The room very cozy. Small but comfortable. Toilet small but clean especially shower gel smell so good when I used I feel fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Geat product for short stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Capt888
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at ibis Novena. Simple, modern, sharp would be how I describe it. Geat value compared to similar options in the same price bracket. Good cheap eateries nearby, or simple reasonably priced cafe food options in the hotel itself. One tip, slide your suitcase under the bed, it frees up space in the room making things a little less cramed!

Reviews.Title: “good except noisy”
Reviews.Author: tmtexpress
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a clean and simple design. The room has enough space for moving around and a big bed. Good arrangement of the furniture items to use up the limited space. Water was flowing out slowly from shower but acceptable. Hotel is located 10-min away from MRT. The walk is managable. Bus stop is just around the corner and there were some nice routes to downtown area. The major problem is about noise. There was a noisy group of residents on the same floor and the noise of them shouting around went straight through our door. We also heard movements from the room next door and above. It makes sleeping a bit disturbed.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the room is very clean, but the location is a bit far from MRT station,,,please notif me if there is an promotion for Accor group hotel,,because the price in promotion season is quite cheap,,thx............

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Exprience”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at a convenient location with the central business district and major offices within 15 mins driving distance. The hotel staff is very welcoming and accommodated our request for an early check in. As far as the room, food and other services are concerned the service is at par with what can be expected from a budget hotel. Would recommend the hotel to anyone travelling to Singapore on a budget requiring cleanliness and some basic amenities from the place of stay.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The staff is very attentive and helpful. The vegetarian breakfast is excellent for someone like me who does not eat meat. Very accessible by MRT, the novena station is about a 6 min walk and give the guest other options for dining.

Reviews.Title: “Prompt Service Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Strelec_12
Reviews.Content: It was Midnight when there was a power trip in my room and the entire floor was affected. It was uncomfortable so I called and informed the reception about this matter, few minutes later the Duty Manager (Mark) came to my room to service the problem. it was flattering that he able to fix the technical issue within 15minutes otherwise i need to shift to another room

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended - Never again”
Reviews.Author: puneetpjl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is some distance away from the city. the rooms are too small for 2 adults. the hotel norms should only allow one person per room. you open a suitcase and you have no floor to step on, no space. the washroom door opens and covers half of the room. a terrible choice. better opt for an ill equipped room rather than staying in a room of the size of a washroom.

Reviews.Title: “much better quality than expected”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The breakfast menu was very good...in fact comparable to Novotel b/f menu. The location was very close to Bus stand on Baleister Road. However accessing Novena, the nearest MRT was difficult since it included walking up a steep incline for around 500metres. All the Hotel staff were freindly except one guy called ADAM at the reception counter. This person is a benchmark of Chinese style arrogancy and curt comments. Try to avoid talking to him. He will make things more complicated than they really are. But otherwise a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Budget Hotel But A Bit Far From Centre”
Reviews.Author: Tanagan
Reviews.Content: As chain budget hotels go, the Ibis Novena does its job well. It's very new, the property is clean, the service is efficient and there are no bad surprises. If you're looking for a clean bed and place to crash in the area, then the Ibis will provide you with a satisfactory stay. That said, in a neighbourhood filled with budget hotels, the Ibis also probably came in at the steepest rates. In general, rooms go for S$150-200/night and for a property which is about a 10 minute walk to the closest MRT station and then 6 stops to downtown, I wouldn't say this is high value. The rooms are small and come with a bed, small bathroom (shower only, no bath) and wall mounted flat screen TV. There are built in shelving units and a wardrobe 'Ikea-style' which maximize use of the small space. Bathroom amenities are basic. Everything is new, and while most of the amenities and decor is budget standard, the bed was very comfortable and linens very clean. Dining is similarly not exactly haute cuisine and I wasn't that impressed with the breakfast offerings. Avoid unless it comes included in the room rate. Unlike most hotels and condos in Singapore, the Ibis does not come with any pool facilities. So, if you just need a place to crash for one night, I think the Ibis Novena can do the trick... however, if you're looking for a more extended stay and in a more central area, then I'd suggest looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Bad accor's standard”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: 3 nights stay in Ibis Singapore Novena was not a nice experience. The quality is much lower than my expectation for an Accor chain hotel. At my first night, we had a trrible experience. The fire alarm rang for 5-10 minutes, but then there was no information on what had happened. When it stopped, only automatic announcement was made and there was no confirmation whatsoever from the staff/management. Second thing was the cleanliness of the facility. Since the first day of our arrival, the cups and glasses available in the room were so dirty. I suppose they have not been cleaned for sometime. We cleaned a cup and use it for drink. In the next day, when we come back to the room, the room have been tidied up, but all the cups and glasses were not replaced, still dirty just like when we left them. I am really dissappointed to the quality of your service. It is far below my expectation of an Accor quality.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel N good Value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal for leisure stay esp for two people. The room is clean and service is too. Being new, the only snag is most taxi drivers seemed not to know exactly where is it located( esp If we mentioned Irrawady Road....is it not well known street?) Otherwise, I find the hotel is very ideal for short/leisure trip.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis Singapore Novena”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Room and amenities are nice and clean. Thanks for the complimentary wi-fi internet access and good security features. Hotel still looks very new. Great service especially on line and up to date reminders.

Reviews.Title: “Small is beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel due to the location is quiet near Novena church and mall around also has a lot of restaurant and reachable for bus with connect to MRT. The rate of this hotel also cheap more over for member of ACCOR. Breakfast menu is good and various enough with service so good and the staff is also helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis - Novena”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hawker place on main road (left) of hotel which opens till 4am everyday. Check out Novena Square for Wang which serves cheap & yummy breakfast. Hotel was at a convenient location, new and has free wifi. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Well done!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Loved the customer service provided here. The restaurant was well priced, good food. Would stay there again. Loved Singapore. We had two rooms, across the hall from each other. Liked that we were able to use our free night as part of the booking.

Reviews.Title: “A no frills hotel.”
Reviews.Author: popeyenolive8 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A very basic hotel . Internet is included which was a great help at night for me because I was tired from walking during the day and I just wanted to stay in, 15mins walk to Novena Station, alternatively , you could catch a bus near to hotel on the main road to Novena Station as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good value & serve its purpose”
Reviews.Author: Fei-Low
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Nov 2011. Took up the offer by hotel and got a good rate by booking 1 month ahead for 3 rooms was offered S$131 per room per day including breakfast. Room is smallish but good for its purpose only complain is that the way the toilet door opens. It opens out into the direction of the bed which shines the toilet light onto the bed and woke up my wife when i goto the toilet at night. Bed is firm, pillow is flat, asked for extra 2 pillows and got them. WIFI in room is good. Breakfast was good, ample and good variety. There is enough seats for everyone. The breakfast on offer here is much better than the other Ibis we stayed in Armsterdam. Hotel is good for its purposes, located in Balastier road which has loads of cheap eating places, favourite being the hawker centre in Whampoa. To access the car park you will need to use a car lift which was an exciting experience for my kids. we drove in spore so the location, even though its a bit far from the main tourist belt but it poses no problem for us. We took the MRT once from orchard and alight in Novena station which is just a 10 minutes walk from the station. Overall we had a good stay here, Sleep quality is resonable except for one morning there were some children playing along the corridor at 7am in the morning. Will stay here again if we get the same rate.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: over all, we found that hotel's staff are helpful and friendly. we didn't have any difficulty with public transportation. you can easly find nearest mrt around 10 minutes walk way and its convinience to get there. or you also could take bus or taxi. the good part is the hotel is non smoking hotel. therefore, this hotel not only suitable for business traveller but also fit for family. For food, if you want to try local food you can find it easly, near hotel they have oen air food court or coffe shop. all within walk way range. the receiptionist is stand by for 24 hours, so you can get their assistance 24 hours. beside that if you would like to wash your own clothes they also have coin laundry at level 2 or if you don't have time the housekeeping will help you. we definately will return to stay at this hotel when we return to singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean place”
Reviews.Author: na_jaMumbai Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good cheek place to stay rooms are small it is far away from the main shopping area and a good 15 to 20 min walk to the mrt. No concierge or room service Not child friendly as place becomes lonely at night Taxi drivers are confused as area is difficult to explain

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Makers' Choice”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the middle of the night we were met with a friendly receptionist. Her smile made us feel welcomed. Our room was a bit small but we had no problem with it since we didn't have to stay in the room most of the day. The complimentary WIFI is a plus. The hotel even has two desk-top in the lobby for guests to use. I will have no problem to going back to that hotel in future if the rate remains cpmpetitive.

Reviews.Title: “Good value option for Singapore”
Reviews.Author: kentlad
Reviews.Content: Exactly what you expect from Ibis - modern, clean, efficient. Rooms are not huge but a perfect base for exploring Singapore. MRT is about 10 mins walk which can be a bit of a challenge in the humidity, but with the MRT is a large shopping centre with cafes and fast food if you like it. Area is quite and away from normal hustle and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I am very satisfied with the service and comfort at this hotel.. All Good. I really enjoyed the holiday in singapore with this hotel. I would recommend this hotel to my friends. Please retained the service of existing and future always provide the best service compared to other hotels

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well-staffed, good business budget hotel with decent restaurant”
Reviews.Author: YourLocalGP
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for just over a week on business in Singapore. It is about 10 mins walk from the nearest MRT, but taxis in Singapore are very cheap. If it is raining then about 60% of the walk is covered thanks to the Foreign Affairs office nearby. The hotel is no-frills. There's a lobby, the restaurant and that's about it in terms of facilities. The reception gets quite crowded at busy times but there are three desks and always staff around. Places to eat around the hotel are mostly food courts, where you can find some delicious grub but they're not at all appropriate for business eating. The restaurant in the hotel was better than I expected. Waiting staff were very attentive. The rooms are small, as you would expect, but they are fitted out smartly. There is a desk, very small fridge (good for keeping some bottles of water in, that's about it) and large TV with a very limited number of international channels (CNN the main one) but it does have video and audio input jacks for you to hook your laptop up to. The international electrical sockets are useful if you've got plugs from everywhere and not all the right adapters. Bed is comfortable (what you expect from a hotel chain) and there is adequate storage for clothing etc, although some drawers would have been useful. There is a small safe, air conditioning, and free Wifi which is slow but usable. The bathroom is fine, shower pressure ok but not power-shower high. Bathroom clean, could probably have done with special attention to a few corners but generally acceptable. Despite leaving my towels on the rails every day, they were still replaced until I personally asked housekeeping to leave them. A comment about the bedroom is that there is a wood-effect vinyl floor instead of a carpet. Although probably better for cleaning, it isn't so pleasant walking around in your bare feet on it, and makes the room feel all the less cosy. For the price though - and hotels in Singapore are expensive - this is a reliable choice. The independents have very mixed reviews and complaints about noise and poor aircon. You won't have those issues at the Ibis as it's a new hotel, purpose-built. My room did not have a connecting door as mentioned in some of the other reviews, so it might be an idea to request one without. If you are a couple, sharing the room, then it could be a little cramped if you were staying for a whole week, but for a weekend checking out Singapore, the Ibis would be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location if you know you're way around Singapore”
Reviews.Author: GTGULL
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as my flat in Singapore was being decorated. Located in Ballestier Road near to Novena MRT and good bus connections, its a good location if you know you're way around. Stayed here two weeks and found the room tidy but compact, but that's expected for an Ibis. Not my taste of decour so was relieved to back home after two weeks, but overall a good value and clean hotel. Special mention to the Service staff - as twice I left my safety box unlocked with cash and cards inside and nothing was taken. So full credit to the honesty of the staff. The food at the restaurant is ok, but plenty of authentic Asian food in Ballestier Road, would recommend Founder Bar Tuk Teh. At Ibis I stuck to western dishes therefore, and found they did a very good fish'n'chips, Advertises that bar stays open until late but that's not the case shuts around 10ish. This part of town isn't as good for bars etc so stay in centre and get cab home if you want to sample the city's best bars. Overall a welcome stay in my home city.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis Novena, small but clean”
Reviews.Author: MarkinMontreal
Reviews.Content: A bit away from downtown but priced right. If you are taking a cab make sure the driver doesn't confuse this with the Ibis downtown as the Novena location is brand new and not well known by cabbies. Rooms are just as pictured on the website, small but nicely done.

Reviews.Title: “iBis hotel @ Novena Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. The reason am chosen this hotel because of the price and brand name. Its new brand hotel located in novena area but I would say the location is not as convenient as the one located in bugis. its about 10 mins walk from hotel to the nearest MRT station. I suggest to buy anything you need like mineral water or foods before you go back to the hotel, because i didn't see any convenient store like 7-11 around the hotel. Overall, i like ibis hotel for it price and brand name. The room is clean and come with free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “My overall experience is "Good"”
Reviews.Author: drbhakat
Reviews.Content: This is my first time stay in this group hotel. The overall arrangement is good. I requested for early check-in and they offered me either a confirmed booking with payment of previous day or free of charge early check-in provided rooms are available. I opted for the second and really felt glad to see that they informed the front desk and I got my room almost more than 4-5 hrs. early. The behaviour of the reception staff were nice. The only problem I faced that there was no supply of drinking water in the room. This was very inconvinient. Every time I needed to buy packaged drinking water. I feel the administration should pay attn into this matter.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Singapore is good city for transportation and we can go somewhere easily by Bus, MRT, and Taxi. This hotel is still new, the smell of room is good, included Breakfast is good. We can go by bus to Novena Square near MRT Novena and coming back to hotel by walking on foot. All staffs of hotel are good and can help us with good information.

Reviews.Title: “Nice new hotel; great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a new Ibis, not all taxi drivers are familiar with it. Very nice + clean rooms. It is a 7 minute walk to the nearest MRT station-most of the walk is shielded from rain. A particular treat is the restaurant downstairs where you can eat a la carte. Great food and service. One minor point is that there was a connecting door in my door to an adjacent room, and this was not insulated (could clearly hear the neigbours).

Reviews.Title: “Alternate Hotel around Thomson Medical Center”
Reviews.Author: Handoko
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had selected this hotel as we had to deal with Thomson Medical Center and it was indeed a good choice as it was only less than 10 minutes walk. For other destination we had to go via Novena MRT station that was within 10 minutes walk. The hotel is new so everything is very clean. My room is a bit too small but functioning well. My bed was a bit too soft for me especially at the edge so made a bit less comfort. Breakfast is typical Ibis I guest, alternatively you can find Mega Food Court that was just 3 minutes away. No complimentary bottled drinking water in the room. Shower water pressure was weak.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MaleneB
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 2-week stay at Ibis Novena. Chosen for it's location close to our offices up the Thompson area. It is a very nice hotel on corner of Irrawaddy/Balestier Road. Staff welcoming and helpful. Rooms are quite compact but well designed to make it comfortable. Bed is one of the nicest I've ever had in a hotel. Small bathroom. Our room had a nice view from fairly large bay window overlooking Balestier Rd. Breakfast is not the most exciting eating experience I've ever had, but a reasonable selection of international and local food, so only the pickiest will go hungry. We also had dinner there once, caesar salad and a club sandwich which was also rather plain but decent and fresh. There are plenty of local eateries in the neighborhood. It's not a touristy shopping district, but a lot more authentic than the tourist crowds on Orchard. Bus connections to Orchard Rd are easy, and there are plenty of taxies to hail on Balestier. Will definitely stay there again on my next visit to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Feel like home”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Everthing is nearby. Very good location. Free wifi in room. also we can have a Scratch n Win. 5%-100%. Luckily I got 10%. Dont forget to buy Tao Shar Pia. It's just several blocks away. Just ask the hotel staffs.

Reviews.Title: “generally above average, but the clean lady came too early and too often.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the staff was nice and helpful. the room is a little bit small.. the location is a little far from MRT. The clean lady came too early and too often even when I was in the room.. first at about 9 and then 10 again... the afternoon when i arrived i even heard the lady knocking someone's door asking for house cleaning..

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is good and also the location is near orchard road and novena shopping center. Staff is friendly. Breakfast was good enough. Compact and clean room and bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasitc Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vasuki T
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family from 1st Nov to 6th Nov 2011.I rate this hotel as top class,full value for money and recomend to anyone who wants to stay in a peaceful place.MRT is 10 mins walk and bus stop 2 mins.Excellent staff,very clean and I will always stay in this hotel every time I visit Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Terikukis
Reviews.Content: When I am in Singapore that's our love nest with my boyfriend....feels like home away from home

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Convenience”
Reviews.Author: BudhyDW Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Ibis Novena is a small hotel efficient service. Checking-in was fast although there is no clear queing system which led to unscrupulous people to cut the line. The room is just the right size for two adults with windows and I like the bathroom with luxury Grohe fittings, which came as a surprise to me. There were ample electrical outlets with universal pins - very useful if you need to charge lot of gadgets. At $1 per head, the sumptuous breakfast is value for money, served at the hip, intimate Oopen restaurant. The hotel is centrally located in a quiet neighborhood at the corner of Irawaddy and Balestier Rd., and you could walk leisurely to Novena MRT in less than 10 minutes. All in all good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for short stopover”
Reviews.Author: Ted M
Reviews.Content: For a short stay or stopover and within a reasonable distance from Orchard Road this Hotel is good value. The staff are most attentive and helpful and the Restaurant meals excellent value. Although the MRT is a good 20minute walk away there are always taxi cabs around with an average fare to Scotts - Orchard Roads about Sin $5.00. As previously stated by others th Units are not overly large but when passing through Singapore we will continue to use the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore”
Reviews.Author: ShantiDubai
Reviews.Content: Hotel booking done through Accor Hotels in Dubai. Rooms were small and not as expected. Breakfast was exceelent. Good service. Good Housekeeping. We used the place only for stay so did not explore the hotel much.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Comfortable Stay. Far from MRT Station but near to Bus Stand. Size of Rooms were not as per expectation. Ambience of the hotel is average. Advantage is that it is in the middle of the city. Not too far from Singapore Zoo (Night Safari) nor too far from Marina Bay & Little India.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business / leisure stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: ibis Novena provides for a comfortable stay during my trips to Singapore. Rooms are clean and comes with free wireless broadband access. A couple of bus trips away from the MRT station. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice 3-star hotel in the north of the city. Extremely clean & well maintained.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A very nice 3-star hotel in the north of the city. Extremely clean & well maintained. However it is quite far to the nearest MRT station (Novena Station), and the bus route is not clearly shown in the hotel lobby. However, considering the price value of this extremely clean room , it is the best value for business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Business-Leisure trip with 2 year old !”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ibis Novena for almost 2 weeks ! Picked it because of the price. Lowest price, decent hotel we could find at the time. We like the location a 10 min walk from MRT and 3 malls. Easy to find cabs right outside the hotel. The rooms were on the smaller side. The cleanliness of the room kept going down as our stay progressed. The breakfast spread is boring. Same food everyday for 13 days. Literally. Maybe one thing on the menu changed. Just one or two vegetarian options. Service is good. Although they did forget to get someone from the restaurant to call me even after repeated reminders. Quiet surroundings. Nice hotel. We would stay again. but would not choose the buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: nice hotel,clean,friendly staff but must be careful when making reservation by internet because i found differences payment of the hotel between my reservation trough the internet and on site, and thanks God the hotel's staff very helpful and fix this error.

Reviews.Title: “First stay, would come again..!!”
Reviews.Author: shahkintu
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ibis Novena is a new premise and very few cabs actually knew that there existed a hotel..!! Secondly this area is a residential area and becomes too silent during the night (after 7pm). Nothing close by, no malls, no shopping, no eateries (especially the hotel ibis menu has only 15 items in all). The closest place nearby is 8-10 SGD by cab.. 15mins walk to the nearby MRT station.. Not at all suggested for family or couples .. its a business hotel for executives who have their own means..

Reviews.Title: “Kindly review your smoking policy!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: When i first stepped into the room, it smelt heavily of cigarette smoke! It's supposed to be a non-smoking establishment. I used my own perfume to freshen up the room, but when returned later, it still smelt of cigarette smoke. I did bring it up to the receptionist who offered to move me 3 floors down, however i decided to put up with it.

Reviews.Title: “nice basic modern hotel but poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: steven b
Reviews.Content: we stayed here as the hotel was pretty much the cheapest 'western standard' hotel that we could find in singapore. had a few problems with the booking as i had pre-ordered the $1 special breakfast but told upon check in i had to pay full price. they eventually honoured the deal i had booked under. Thankfully they did as the breakfast really want worth much more than $1. very poor!!! the hotel is quite compact so not very quiet. there is building work going on nearby so dont expect a sleep in. the rooms however were clean and modern. there is a MRT only 5 mins walk away which whisks you straight to orchard road in under 10 mins. all in all was ok. i'd choose it again but only if there wasnt anything else cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: cooperdes
Reviews.Content: only 2 stops on mrt to orchid road good rooms and bfast very nice , great staff in all areas. nice new rooms , not large but more than enough for one person.

Reviews.Title: “Advanced booking room rate more expensive than regular rate”
Reviews.Author: coandy Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: i booked the hotel as early as Feb. 2011 to attend a wedding of a friend on Oct. 2011.. When I checked the rate, I found out that my rate of 148 for first night and 158 for second night was way above the rate which my friends got (S$ 120) when they booked at almost the same time. Further the advertised walk in rate was the same at S$148. I felt I was robbed since very early bookings was advertised to be a "special introductory" rate.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: piscesgirl60
Reviews.Content: We were in a group of 4 adults. We stayed at the Ibis as a stopover on our way to Europe and then again on our way back. I must say I was a little apprehensive after reading reviews, but I had already booked on line through an opening special. Our rooms were more than adequate, I must say this bed was the most comfortable I had slept in over the 3 weeks of our holiday. The staff in the restaurant were fantastic, very accomodating and even new what drinks we all had at happy hour, served with a friendly smile and a bit of a chat to boot. The one thing I would mention though is the fridge that is supplied in the room is absolutely pathetic. Ours did not work, neither did the other couples. More like a doll house fridge. On the whole our experience was a pleasant one. Novena square is a 10 minute walk away and orchard st is 3 stops on MRT. Cabs are so cheap that we caught one to anywhere we wanted to go. Very frequent as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Ibis Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Cant fault this Ibis, excellent value, helpful friendly staff, bit of a walk to MTR station but cabs are so inexpensive the semi remote location of the hotel does not make this an issue. Beds pretty hard and no aircon in corridors or reception, if these were rectified this hotel would have to be the best value is Singapore. Rooms very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel if ur into sports.”
Reviews.Author: SAPOID Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Came to Singapore for a night's stay. When I arrived the taxi driver and I were looking for the main lobby. We circled the hotel twice. In fact there was the lobby by the side of the main street. Look like an entrance to a restaurant. Which the resto is right by the main lobby. Its the same great quality from accor, same standard as the other Ibis in town. Pretty much the exact copy of the other Ibis in terms of quality, looks, service. It is quite pricey for an Ibis, but hey with the guaranteed quality Im getting, I dont mind. Location wise its only 3 MRT stops away from shopping central of Orchard, or many stops away from the Financial area. If your there for work, Ibis Bencolen is better choise. If you're into sports the a Sports Mall 800m from the hotel or 10min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis Novena Undetected”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, friendly & helpful reception but not many taxi drivers seems to know where Ibis Novena is actually located even when address given to them. Maybe a little more media advertisement may be required here.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: loved this hotel. fluffy bed, great shower, lovely view over the city.absolutly fantastic restaurant!!! outstanding value for money and outstanding friendly service!!! we just stayed for a stopover and caught the shuttle bus to the hotel. it took some time to get there due to rush hour in the morning. on our way back we needet to catch an early flight and the shutle bus doesnt run that early. anyway we caught a taxi for 24 bucks which was great value for money considering the airport is aprox. 20 km from the city!

Reviews.Title: “Stay was Comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: AmiteshPatro Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very clean&the Staff are friendly.Intoto Ibis assures U a pleasant stay and value for money in a decent budget as Singapore is expensive. The MRT Novena is 10 mins walking from the hotel and it takes on 10-15 mins to get to the heart of the city by cab.Its a decent place to stay with family or if UR visiting on work.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Novena Ibis Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall, it was a wonderful experience. I will definitely stay at Ibis Singapore Novena again when I am in Singapore. Staff were excellent; very helpful, and helpful. The room, lobby, hallways were very clean. The bed was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, compact hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeV67
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ibis Novena for seven nights, we found the hotel to be clean rooms very compact but functional, everything was in working order. Cleanliness was good, good comfortable bed.I read quite a few different reviews prior to booking the room and some were quite negative however I found staff to be friendly especially when we arrived at 1am, they were helpful and polite. Nearest MRT is Novena station which is a 10 - 15min walk from hotel which was no problem for us however others might find it too much particulary in the heat. Only negative for the room itself is the lack of a bar fridge, to keep your water cold, unusual in such a hot country not to have a fridge, there is a little " box " to keep cold things but it's small and only a 500ml bottle or 2 will fit there, it seems to have been an after thought that this was placed there perhaps they had complaints due to a lack of a proper fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Stay from 23SEP2011~26SEP2011 (F1 Period)”
Reviews.Author: Pokie L
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel 10Mins walk to the Novena MRT Station Clean During F1 period only HKD1,400 per room per night Free Wifi No toothbrush. No shaving kit

Reviews.Title: “Nice Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ivy075
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ibis Novena for three nights late May 2011. Rooms were small, but new and clean, breakfast very nice. Only drawback I felt, was that we needed to walk a bit to train station in order to catch MRT to city. For us that was not a major problem though feel it could worry some people - but again short cheap ride in taxi gets you there. Breakfast was good. Typical Ibis and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “clean and new hotel for sightseeing travelers”
Reviews.Author: combugs
Reviews.Content: My friend and I briefly stayed at Ibis Novena for one night last week. Since we spent most of our time sightseeing in the city, the hotel provided a clean and tidy room for us to shower and sleep. The hotel does not have much facilities so it was good for travelers like us who just needed to spend the night. The breakfast buffet did not have a wide variety of food but was sufficient. The only downside was that it had quite a distance from the MRT station and there were no taxis at the hotel, we had to go to the main street to catch a taxi to downtown and were stuck in traffic for a bit. One thing I appreciated most was the complimentary free wifi access within the entire building. Overall, I would recommend Ibis Novena to travelers who plan to spend most of their time in the city and looking for a hotel of good value just to rest and sleep.

Reviews.Title: “economy hotle”
Reviews.Author: rathi_star
Reviews.Content: ibis novena is nice hotel .for vegetarian no good option of food , otherwise it is good . rooms are average as we r paying less .lobby is good . for Indian food u have to go little India by tacking a cab . i think its a new hotel so not much popular between cab driver . u must keep visiting card of hotel with u at every time. free internet and WIFI .(marina bay sands charge for it ) All necessary thing are available in rooms like other hotel . if u r Indian vegetarian then its better to stay in little India . it will save ur cab rent in Singapore .

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: patcParis
Reviews.Content: I have seen better Ibis (e.g. Warsaw, Vienna) but the Ibis Novena is a nice, good value hotel which offered all I needed for a two-night stop on my way to Australia from Paris. It is located in a nice neighbourhood, around 800m from the Novena MRT station and the Novena shopping center. From there I could conveniently go to Orchad Rd or Marina Bay by MRT. The restaurants and food court in the shopping mall offered plenty of choices for meals. The room was a typical Ibis room, basic but very functional. I had nothing to complain about because I had good sleep nights during my stay and the bathroom was practical. All the front desk staff members were very friendly and helpful. In the lobby, there were two free computers with Internet access although the software didn't permit connection to secured web sites. One young lady from the staff gave me direction to a cybercafe just 5 minute walk from the hotel. I would definitely stay at the Ibis Novena again.

Reviews.Title: “I am satisfied with my stay in the hotel”
Reviews.Author: qqtraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 2 nights during August. It took me 15 min slow walk from Novena MRT to the hotel, or USD3.5 if I took a taxi. It was located in the medical hub of Singapore, Novena is 2 stations away from Orchard MRT on the northern route. The room was spacious and high ceiling. Bed was clean and comfortable. The hotel decor was very similar to IBIS SINGAPORE ON BENCOOLEN. Free wifi was much better than that of Bencoolen but still it was a bit slow. Also, shower water was slow and the water temperature was uneven, hope the hotel would take note of that. In general, I think the hotel is value for money. I am satisfied with my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “nice new hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bellej1981
Reviews.Content: To save money we stayed here at the end of our honeymoon. There was a deal because it had just opened in April. We spent so much time sightseeing we weren't bothered by the room size which is very small! It's about 10 minutes walk from the train and not the closest to restaurants. The staff were friendly and helpful and I wasn't the biggest fan of the breakfast on offer but they be just because I got spoilt rotten in Thailand with full buffets.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: designercottage
Reviews.Content: Some time I wonder what traveling is all about. Regarding business, leisure or just need a bed for the night.( or just hrs) I am an easy traveler, normally I will consider the hotel charges first and comments accordingly. If we pay for a cheaper hotel, we really can't expect 5 starts services. What I really like about the hotel is, probably the rate is the cheapest compared to many Singapore hotel, yet close to MRT (Train station) and many attraction sites. I can understand if some travelers might consider the room a bit tinny or a small box. The breakfast is the best, mixed of Asian and Western breakies. Overall with the rate, free internet and lovely good quality fruits variety as breakfast. I don't think we can really complain without reflecting our quality as a bit fussy. I did enjoyed my stay in S'pore Ibis. I soon booked into Shanghai Ibis during my next stop.

Reviews.Title: “Not suitable for business”
Reviews.Author: VerityWu
Reviews.Content: Hotel is about 10-15 minutes work from Novena MRT station depending on your speed of walking. There is road work along the Irrawddy road so do be careful. The room is small with no toothbrush provided, so please remember to bring toothbrush and toothpaste. Also there is no hair conditioner provided. It is very inconvenience for business travellers. Limited choices for breakfast (only one type of egg was offerred) but enough for a simple breakfast. The heather at shower in the bathroom is not funtioning well, please do be careful on adjusting the temperature. Worst of all, I got a wet shower cap in my room during the 1st night - which look like a recycle one!! Overall, I do not recommend for business traveller as it is really not value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay ever”
Reviews.Author: Laila_Isabella
Reviews.Content: Check-in staff's service is alright. Got my room and its a nice cosy room. The bed is AWESOME!!! Slept so well!!! I had my dinner for 2 nights straight & they remember what I had the previous night which is amazing! Rarely staff have this kind of good service. There is this waiter named Husin (I forgot how to spell his name correctly,pardon me) who was attentive throughout my dinner. Asking me if the food is fine etc. I'm impressed by him & gave my compliments to the hotel manager which I have yet to receive any replies. Breakfast is ok. Early riser meal consists of cereal & the next morning I had a proper breakfast which consist of pasta, bread etc. Overall, my place here is great! Will definitely stay here & recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Big Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Xian09
Reviews.Content: This hotel was part of a Singapore Vacation holiday to Bangkok and then we stayed 2 nights in Singapore. Since it was part of our Singapore vacation we expectted it to be a great hotel like our other hotels have been with Singapore Vacations. Our travel agent had reserved a room with twin beds. When we checked into the hotel they told us(a friend) that they didn't have a twin room that is not what our agent reserved. It was a queen room. We insisted and the agent checking us in put us in a twin room. We got to the room and within ten minutes another person called and said we couldn't keep the room and were moving us back to a queen. She came up with a key and moved. I called my husband in the states and had him call the travel company and talk to someone. They confirmed that we indeed had a queen room and called someone at the hotel and we were moved in the morning. This was not a pleasant experience. We inquired at the desk about calling a cab to take us somewhere and were told that a taxi would charge us $5 just to come to the hotel and we'd do better if we walked a block and got a taxi on the street. Our room faced a construction site where men were working and we had to keep our blinds drawn during most of the time. Men working could look into our room. The hotel is new and rooms are so tiny. No closet, no chair . When I went to breakfast in the morning it was full of school children(well behaved) on a school trip. I do believe this is the type of hotel it is. Not a hotel where adults go for a nice stay and rest and touring. It was poorly located and construction going on on both sides of the street. There is a mall about a 10 min. walk away but on the street in front of the hotel are tile shops and shops with bathroom fixtures. I cannot imagine why this hotel was used as part of a vacation package. Our hotel in Bangkok was wonderful and well located. This was not the way you want to end a trip. ..

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi07
Reviews.Content: We were booked here by Singapore Airlines as they changed our flights. It was nice to stay in a new hotel. The rooms are small but well designed making good use of space. The hotel is not close to any sites or large shopping malls but is a short staightforward walk to Novena Square which is a small local mall with several eating places and Novena MRT stop making it easy to get around. Also a short walk down the busy main road that the hotel is on there are some great little authenic and cheap Chinese Restaurants with really good food. The hotel is clean and the staff pleasant when spoken to. The hotel is very basic and doesn't offer any ameanities other than a cafe. There is no guest seating area and no pool which is a real shame. We had a late flight on the day we left and found it extremely long and tiring waiting for our flight with nowhere comfortable to wait in the hotel as you can only walk the streets for so long. I noticed their advertised rack rate on the wall when we were there and thought it quite high for what you got. We only paid about S$60 more per night for a beautiful room at the 5* Conrad Centennial in Mariner Bay which offered everything you expect from a five star hotel. If you can get a great rate here and you can't stretch your budget then it is a good place to choose as its new.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic and far from the centre”
Reviews.Author: lpdksingh
Reviews.Content: Brand new hotel, clean and basic rooms (IBIS standard). 15 min up hill walk to central metro station. No pool but needs one. Nothing interesting around the hotels-no shops, no restaurants, and sights. Not bad value for a SHORT stay.

Reviews.Title: “A new ibis with brand new room standard”
Reviews.Author: DitaGenier
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the weekend and thought that the room was simple, practical (although rather small) and loved the new ibis new room. Location wise, not the best location in Singapore but the MRT station is just 5 minutes away by foot. If you're in the country for medical purpose, this hotel has the perfect location as it is surrounded by medical centres. But love the fact that the surrounding is very quiet and clean. The lobby is quite small and minimalist. no chairs to wait & sit down.

Reviews.Title: “Nice...”
Reviews.Author: Nico2309
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights and I have to say that despite it being a relatively new and small hotel, we still had a wonderful time. And with the very expensive hotel prices in Singapore, we have to say that the hotel was a great find for its price. First, even though it seems that its location is quite residential and if you go out of the hotel at night you'll have nowhere to go to, it is still near the Novena station and taxis do pass it often so there is no difficulty getting some place else. Also, even though there was a construction going on beside it, once inside, we did not hear any noise of some sort and we actually had two nights of good sleep in there. We arrived earlier than the check-in time but the receptionists were more than happy to assist and we were immediately provided with our room. I just forgot the name of the male receptionist who assisted us but he was really nice and helpful and very professional, too. Now, for the bathroom, I would have to say that it was very adequate. Of course, like any other Ibis hotels, it was fairly small. But I guess with the factor of the hotel being a very new one, everything was working perfectly fine. All in all, me and my friend think that if we ever go back to Singapore, Ibis Hotel Novena would definitely still be one of our top choices.

Reviews.Title: “New and reasonable value”
Reviews.Author: creativepage
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night, at short notice on 6th floor (our of 10). Brand new hotel so clean and stylish. Restaurant was open until 10pm, but was happy for us to order right on closing and stayed open for other guests after us. Food was cooked to order and good value. Double room just about coped with two adults and an 8 year old in the queen sized bed. No warning on website or during online booking procedure that they couldnt offer a rollaway bed (I suggest as there isb;t room for one in the rooms). Once two suitcases where opened up there was not a lot of room, but have heard of worse situations (no window in room, no room to open suitcase etc.) Bed and pillows very comfy aircon fairly quiet, bathroom functional and clean, with good pwerful stream of hot water etc. Staff polite if a little cold/reserved.

Reviews.Title: “OKAY IF THE PRICE IS RIGHT!”
Reviews.Author: pisamoorings
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ibis Novena for two nights on our way home from Thailand. Check-in was prompt and efficient. Our room was quite small – probably around 25 square metres – so it was difficult for two people to move around the room at one time. The bathroom was also small but adequate. We asked for a quiet room on check-in but was given a room next to the elevator shaft. One of the lifts developed a fault during the night and made an annoying sound when used which kept waking us up. Reception staff appeared to be aware of the issue when we complained about it in the morning. Cleaning staff took our towels and bathmat away but forgot to replace them. A phone call to housekeeping and three hours later still no towels. A second phonecall resulted in clean towels within five minutes (after we insisted we wanted to shower) but no bathmat. We had dinner in the restaurant and that was very good. A promotional discount was offered to hotel guests so the price was reasonable. Be warned that refrigeration in the room is tiny – the 12 volt type you find in some vehicles. There is no mini-bar which didn’t bother us. You could easily hear other guests in the hallway. Accommodation appears to be very expensive in Singapore and we managed to get an opening special so the price we paid was pretty good value. Because the hotel only opened a few months ago, some taxis drivers are unaware of the hotel’s location. We arrived in the dark and our taxi driver drove around the block several times before finding it so a printed google map might be a good idea. The hotel is a 10-15 minute walk from three large shopping malls and the Novena MRT station. Reception staff were happy to give directions and advice or ring for a taxi. Internet was available in the lobby and there was free wi-fi throughout the hotel. They kindly stored our bags in their locker room as we weren’t flying out until evening. It is a good clean three star hotel - there is no pool or other amenities. If the price is right it is okay for a night or two as long as you are happy with limited space.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in Singapore for business travel”
Reviews.Author: ozorule20102011
Reviews.Content: I am a regular business traveler to Singapore. I like Accor hotels but some of them are too expensive for my travel budget. I stayed at the Ibis Bencoolen and I liked it there but the rates are more than the Novotel. I switched to the NEW ibis in Singapore. I have to say, this is a much nicer Ibis because it is smaller and in a quieter area for a good night sleep after a busy day at work. The train station is closer then the Bencoolen Ibis. Although taxi's are so convenient and very cheap in Singapore. This is a good 3 star hotel. It lives up to the ibis brand and what you would expect for a 3 star hotel. I actually don't like to eat at the hotel restaurants but at this new Ibis there is a proper restaurant and food is great. If you are like me and go on a business trip for a few days at a time, then you must get sick of hotel food. That's what I like about the new ibis, a short walk to 2 shopping malls and a lot of restaurants. I like the walking after a full day at the office and unlike the Bencoolen hotel where you are always walking and bumping into millions of people who have no manners, you can have a nice quiet walk to the shopping mall and wind down after work. Staff are great, very friendly and speak good English - ones you can understand. I was pleased to find out that I can book this hotel on a corporate rate. More the reason I like this hotel more. The rooms are spacious enough for an Ibis hotel. Free internet is great for business travel. It saves a lot of money. Yes I would like to recommend this hotel. I believe this is a good 3 star hotel in Singapore. As we all know the accommodation in Singapore is very expensive. As a business person, I believe this hotel deserves a true review.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not special”
Reviews.Author: Niqqz
Reviews.Content: Actually the staffs is good, but not really for the hotel. As the new hotel, this hotel still need many improvements. Frist, there is no lobby there ! so we must standing so long just for check in. second, the room and the bathroom is very small, we can't enter it easily. third, the WIFI is not really good, I asked the staff but they still can't help much, so I tried many times by myself until I can use the WIFI last, the location is bad. So far for MRT station, and if we use taxi to this hotel is so hard. The driver even don't know about this hotel's location. So I think this hotel not really reccomended, still need improvements.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunately, I can't recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: CherieA
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in May 2011 and I was very happy to leave. The rooms were small, reasonably clean and okay, but I expected more from a new hotel. There was wifi available in rooms and free computers in the lobby, but it was very crowded and very busy. The staff were reasonably friendly but not particularly helpful. My main complaint was with breakfast. The restaurant was very crowded and we had to wait for ages for a table to become available. There was no area to wait in and we were constantly being bumped by people walking in and out of the restaurant. We wouldn't have waited if we hadn't already pre-paid for breakfast. For four people, breakfast was $S60. Reasonably priced if the food was okay, but between the four of us, we had two glasses of juice, two coffees and a marmalade toast. The rest of the western food was completely inedible. Very unpleasant. Overall, I wouldn't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rollyk1980
Reviews.Content: Being a new hotel, we thought we were getting excellent value for money. The room and bathroom was small, however not really an issue to us (unlike some other reviews). Our problem was with the complete lack of soundproofing in the rooms. A family with small children that were staying on the same floor considered it appropriate to run around screaming down the hallway until 11pm at night and again when leaving at 4am. I am a pretty heavy sleeper but honestly, it was like the people were in the room with us. Management need to seriously look at soundproofing the doors at least if they want return custom...
