We checked in under the Member's 'STAY, SPIN & WIN' Promotion + FREE 1-Day City Tour, Breakfast & Internet at an average cost of $140 per night. We had to ask for our 1-Day City Tour pass. Who knows what the "spin and win" component of the package was - yes we could have asked but we were new to Singapore and getting the simplest of directions seemed to get lost in translation. I was disappointed that there were no travel brochures or city maps available. Being first time visitors to Singapore with no real planned itenerary it was pretty difficult to find our way around. Staff seemed unwilling to order taxi's - rather, sent us out into the heat to flag one down - which was pretty difficult. Taxi drivers didn't know where the hotel was either... Breakfast was ok. Food at the Hotel (Lunch) was below average and very much overpriced. We were allowed a late checkout which was definately an upside to the hotel. I dont particualrly like writing bad reviews, but after two weeks in Cambodia and the previous night at Pullman Bangkok King Power, this place was a real disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Small clean neat hotel, getting transport is a problem though”
Reviews.Author: jerrykuching
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ibis Novena for five nights. Found the rooms similar to all the Ibis-es that we;ve been in. Price is slightly cheaper than the Ibis Hotel Bencoolen and after staying here for five nights the reason seems obvious. Getting transport here is terrible. You would have to walk around ten minutes going uphill to get to the nearest MRT station. And taxi drivers in singapore does not seem to keen to send us back to the hotel at night. One even got lost looking for the hotel. However, i believe its a small price to pay if you want to get a cheap international hotel in Singapore as this country is very expensive when it comes to hotels. So for us the only downside is the location. Other than that, this hotel delivers as other Ibis hotel delivers. Cheap quality hotels at an affordable price. And most importantly, this hotel provides free Wi-Fi as I know most hotels dont.

Reviews.Title: “No Fix for Serious Room Problems”
Reviews.Author: aMakUzr
Reviews.Content: Our room's shower continuously varied between too hot to too cold every half-minute or so. After 2 requests for it to be repaired (once in writing) with nothing done, we left the hotel. Our room also had small bugs and a friend's room had larger bugs.

Reviews.Title: “had a nice sleep in the very small room”
Reviews.Author: martin1344
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this ibis hotel 2 months after its opening, it seems that a few taxi driver knew the location. after we arrived from the airport and getting down at the nearest Novena MRT station, we just kew that the hotel is still far away from the-what-they-call-novena, we need to walk 15 minutes to reach the hotel, they should name it Ibis Balestier i think. beside that, i experienced the efficient check in, but the hotel had no lobby to wait or sit just like the ordinary branded 3 star hotel. the room was still fully furnished because it's new but very small, the smallest room i ever had with ibis brand, everything is small. the bathrooml; they have a complete set of amenities but you can't move without touching anything. they don't provide mineral water because potable water is safe to drink. but every dissapointment dissappeared when we had a long good night sleep and wake up late the day after.

Reviews.Title: “I definately recommend this hotel to everyone”
Reviews.Author: Happ041
Reviews.Content: I travel alot and stay at Ibis hotels. I found this hotel ibis in Singapore much more upmarket then what I am used to. Great value in Singapore. He has everything we needed and a very nice bed. For me with all the travelling I do, thsi was the best bed I slept in for a long time and i did not expect this in a ibis type of hotel. May be because it is brand new, anyway it was a great bed. It is a brand new hotel and only been open for few months I think. The staff are friendly and wiling to help. We needed to go to Marina Bay sands and on the map it looked like it was so far away. The very helpful staff at front desk gave us tips about travelling in singapore and we were got to marina bay sands in 15 monutes in a taxi. The cost of taxi in singapore is very cheap. Just for fun we took the train as well and from the hotel we walked less then 10 minutes to the train station and then got to so many great places to see by just getting on and off of the train . The hotel has a restaurant - a proper one and not like some Ibis hotels. Food was wonderful. Drinks are a bit expensive in singapore. We had to fly out of singapore very late in the evening and the hotel let us check out at late and that was very nice because with the hot weather in singapore we needed that extra. I want to mention the guy at front desk Adam , he was always friendly and whenever we asked questions , he helped us. I would recommend this hotel to anyone if you travelling to singapore. By the way they have free internet in the rooms and in the lobby too.

Reviews.Title: “Great value accommodation in handy location”
Reviews.Author: MelbV
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the ibis novena in May 2011 one month after the hotel opened. We got a pretty good rate as an opening special and due to expensive hotel prices we'd seen we decided to give this hotel a go. Being slightly wary due to other not-so-great reviews and the possibility of the hotel still having 'teething problems' we were both pleasantly surprised at the fantastic stay we had here! I agree with others that taxi drivers have no idea about the hotel due to it's just being open so I would recommend you say 'novena' and 'near balestier rd' as this is a main rd on which the hotel corners. I would also recommend the nearest mrt (novena) which is a short walk away (slightly uphill!) and if you prefer a closer option there are buses on balestier rd that head into the city. Now the hotel itself: we arrived at 3am due to delayed flight so had no competition checking in. Staff were very efficient and polite. We requested a quiet room as had read reviews of construction next door (still ongoing as of may 19) and got just this. Were very happy about that! The rooms are small but functional and Beds are comfy. the bathroom is very decent, with enough room to be comfortable and the shower is seperated by a screen door so keeps the floor dry. If you're strategic with you can store suitcases under the beds which frees up all the floor space. There's also a large desk and chair plus a couchy seat by the large window. This was a good idea as it keeps the room bright. Unfortunately there is no fridge in the room, but truthfully after 1 day we got used to it and just purchased long-life milk from the supermarket for our hot drinks and this was fine. We were so happy with the room and cleanliness of the room and hotel. It is brand new so of course all the areas look fantastic and 'shiny'. We never ate in the restaurant as we just booked the lowest basic rate but the buffet Breakfast food looked really good. I enjoyed my stay here thoroughly and thought the staff were very friendly and helpful, especially kindly holding our luggage for 7 hours after we checked out! The location is very good too, close to mrt which is 2 stops from orchard and 4 stops from city hall. Also the mrt is under a pretty good shopping centre (novena square) which has restaurants, supermarket and many specialty stores where we had breakfast and several meals. I liked it as well because it seemed quiet yet not far from the craziness of the city. Would highly recommend if you get a good rate. Some travellers may prefer more luxury, hotel facilities (no pool, gym, etc) and being in the centre of the city but if all you want is a good clean room in a handy and relatively quiet location, you can't go past this one!

Reviews.Title: “elite”
Reviews.Author: xiemaralee
Reviews.Content: well ,precisely it is fabulous in asia's hotel, comfortable and calm in the appealing of the eyes , the best hotel in singapura i swear ,really a must stayed places and spending your money here is really a wort it one! and if i were you i'll be book here right away if you will want a relaxed ,sociable and comfortable vacations. a memories to remember forever!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: milvoon
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my family (4 of us, in 2 rooms), we got the promotional opening rate of SGD 100 per room (which was really good for the value, because Singapore hotels are really expensive). The hotel just opened in April, we stayed in early May - so everything was new. I've never stayed in a ibis hotel before, but I must stay, this is the best 3 star hotel that I've stayed in Asia. The rooms were very clean - small but functional - good bed, contemporary furnishings, 32" LCD TV, hot shower (the hot and cold water was a bit intermittent, as per the other reviews. I liked the orange scented body and hair shampoo they supplied), sufficient storage space (they've got a shelving area and a place to hang clothes (a set of hangers provided). Just note that they don't have fridges in their rooms. The previous reviews mentioned the rooms being a bit noisy because you could hear people talking outside along the corridor - we found this to be true. The walls are quite thin - lucky for us, there wasn't much activity along our corridor at night, so it wasn't too bad. They've also got free wifi throughout the hotel and two Macs at the lobby for free internet. Internet was fast, it was really convenient to have access at the lobby - we were doing research on where to go. They've got a restaurant next to the lobby - but we didn't add the breakfast option (+ SGD 15). Outside the hotel - there are plenty of coffeeshops and the Mega Food Court (choice of hawker fare), there's also a few 'tau sa piah' shops - local pastries, which you can try out. Location is alright - about 10-15 minutes walk away from Novena MRT. and there's a bus stop on Balestier Road 5 minutes walk away from the hotel. Staff were generally helpful and friendly. Pros' 1. If you get a good rate (ie, $100-ish), this is a very good deal! 2. Close enough to public transport 3. Good food options nearby Cons' 1. Thin walls - can hear people talking outside the rooms 2. intermittent hot and cold water for the shower (might want to be a bit careful.. as suddenly the water gets hot, even though you haven't changed the position of the mixer)

Reviews.Title: “Ibis - Novena- good to stay”
Reviews.Author: Moduman
Reviews.Content: Ibis- Novena- we booked this for a 4 day stay in Singapore. Luckily we got a good price , it being a time of promotional offers for this place which has just come up in Novena. Ibis hotels are quite moderately priced and not very cheap with rates. A good place to stay considering its central location and proximity to the metro station ( the lifeline of travel in Singapore).Bus stops just outside again making it convenient to travel. Service was not bad at all. Of course as any IBIS hotel, cleanliness was well up to the mark . The room was well designed to fit a small open wardrobe, a sitting area , a work table and a double bed , in the really limited space there was in it. Biggest drawback of the room however was the unavailability of a refrigerator in the room, which is now a normal facility in all medium rated hotels.Especially in a place with warm weather as in Singapore, a refrigerator would have been a welcome amenity. Besides, travelling with young children , one needs a refrigerator for the milk and fruits we need to carry along everywhere. Also , one must remember that this is a basic hotel, so do not look forward to other amenities like gym,pool or kids play area. Apart from that missing amenity, it was a nice place to stay in every other way, fulfilling its purpose, mainly as a basic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Super low or don't go!”
Reviews.Author: shez12
Reviews.Content: The only reason we chose to stay here was because we managed to book during their super low 'name your own price' opening special rate ($71AUD for 2 nights - no kidding!) + we payed for a full rate for an extra night ($145AUD). Singapore being and extremly expensive city for accomodation - it seemed like a good bargain! Location wise it is quite far from main attractions, a 7 minute walk up hill to nearest novena MRT. Most taxi drivers do not know where it is because its so new and its actually on the corner of balestier & irrawaddy rd. There is novena shopping centre and a 24hr eatery and some restaurants nearby. Also, a yummy 'tau sar' biscuit place just down the road. Rooms are pretty much standard size - same as other Ibis hotels. Things I don't like about the room is the curtain rail was pretty tacky and the water pressure was horrendous - inconsistent hot and cold water!! When we stayed the establishment was only about 80% running interms of facilities (one of the lifts was not operational, the downstairs female toilets have plumbing issues, no gym yet). You could definetly tell which were the more experienced staff members. I had problems with my booking because I had to book seperately in order to get the special rate. I told them I didn't want to have to check-out the next day and they said it was fine they took both my reservation numbers... only to find that after returning from my hotel on the 2nd night we were locked out of our room because the guy who checked us in forget to amend the duration of our stay. Then the staff asked us to provide the reservation no. again and we told her we already gave both of them to the guy that checked us in. She couldn't find the 2nd res. no. because she didn't handle our check-in and told us to check our emails again. Luckily the guy that checked us in was still there and we pointed him out but he was already preparing to go home. Eventually, she gave us access back to our room and we told her we would sort the matter out in the morning. There was also another angry customer who was locked out at that time as well! Worse of all was during this time is must have been shift change time so there was only 1 person serving customers.. super slow. The guy that checked us in was off for the day but was still standing there playing with his mobile while there was a super long queue for service. And yet we had to wait for the new staff to start work - seriously it doesn't hurt to work a little extra. I would recommend waiting another 6 months or until they have full facilities and better staff service/training. But even than the location plumbing/water issues wouldn't really make up for the standard price they want to charge - there are definetly better hotels out there!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of improvement required”
Reviews.Author: miawhua
Reviews.Content: I've booked it through online at a special rate for the opening special promo. i was told that check in time was 2pm. When i arrived about 4pm, i was told my room was not ready and the check in agent was not able to tell me how long i have to wait. Later on i was told that there was already a list of people waiting for their rooms too. Only till i further probe for a specific time and i got a room. When i got the room, i was shock to see that the shower room had an indication, do not use. How on earth am i going to shower? Also there's no dustbin in the room and bathroom for trash and i got to call for one. The staff did not believe that there isn't one and kept telling me its in the shower room. it was noisy along the corridor and i could hear people talking very loudly. When i ask for a late check out i was told to check the next day but when i call up to ask, no one answered the call.

Reviews.Title: “Only 3 star Hotel in 30yrs of travel with no Fridge!”
Reviews.Author: AusSamui Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We arrived hotel about 6am and we did not expect to check-in until later,staff were very accommodating telling us they would have a room at 10am and offered us to sit in restaurant with coffee and pastries, Eventually we we offered breakfast by the more than helpful Supervisor. So far so good and room was ready at 10.am but to my surprise they do not have a porter service! We opened our door to find a very cramped room and I spent 10mins looking for a fridge as we had some perishables to store ,only to be told by reception there are no fridges in the Rooms.....that's a first in this type of hotel for me ! Again the staff came to the rescue and offered to store our goods in Kitchen Fridge. Construction Noise next door is earth shattering so don't expect a peaceful stay for the next few months. Breakfast is basic but the Fresh ground coffee machines lifted our breakfast experience.. Staff were very friendly and helpful which was needed to override the negatives of this new Hotel. I hope management can take the hint to acquire fridges and a porter service and fix the hot water which is very inconsistent, then I would highly recommend ibis novena once adjacent construction is complete. As location is quite central with MRT 5-10min walk and many Taxi's and Buses on front road.Also the area is renowned for great local Food.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of teething problems”
Reviews.Author: docpinto
Reviews.Content: We had booked two rooms from apr22-26 at the new Ibis Novena.I had specifically requested adjoining rooms with a connecting door on a higher floor ,but was told that was not available.We were given two adjacent rooms one the 5th floor instead.What a shock it was when we opened one of the rooms to find it was previously occupied...the guests clothes and luggage was still there!! Thank god the guest wasn't!! Seems this has happened before with another person on here.We were shifted to the second floor ,facing the construction...and believe me it was horrible. i insisted on being moved the next day and was moved to the 8th floor which was so much better.The rooms are small,but function and clean. i had booked the $1 breakfast deal for all four days but was told that i could only get it for the first day..I had to convince the receptionist that it was for all 4 days...most embarrassing. Mr Jarryd ,the duty mgr was most helpful and usually sorted our problems. Ali in all not a very enjoyable stay at this new hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Roro_woof
Reviews.Content: Got good deals and stay here for 3 days. Hotel is brand new so most of taxi drive don't know the exact location. Walk in to novena mrt is 10 min of hiking exercise. Room is clean and compact, just enough for two person. Minus side: no fridge and the hot water is so frustating...inconsistent hot water..alternating between hot and cold water. Overall it's a value for money if they fix the hot water issue.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but functional”
Reviews.Author: aikman1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night. The room and bathroom is indeed quite small but it is functional. Might be a bit cramped with two people and their luggage inside the room. The only negative for me was that since the bed is so close to the door, which is not soundproof, I heard everything going on in the hallway including doors closing and people chatting. This made it hard to sleep. It is an 8 min walk to the MRT but it is on a mostly residential street so the walk can seem longer. There are also no chairs in the lobby for you to wait for people or for tour buses. I'd recommend it if you can get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Clean helpful & friendly”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaParu
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7th April'11for 5 nights got it as an opening special.Rm may be small but roomy. Narrow cupboards spacious for storage.Has in rm TV, reading table & chair.Rm lightening is good. Rm comes with "Safe" handy to store documents & money.Pillow bit hard on the head.Nights are quiet except for occassional noises made late arriving guests. Rm doors & lifts operate on guest ID card.Large resturant attached to lobby. Rms cleaned daily. Coffee & tea making facility. NO rm fridge which was a drawback as we could not keep eateries cool.Free internet in the reception lobby. Friendly staff. Location: Hotel facing Balastier Rd.Many food stalls @ walking distance like the Balastier Food Market & the Plaza.A brisk walk from the hotel to the famous Novena Church be under 10 minutes, from here another brisk walk will lead to the Novena MRT.Safe walking even after 9pm. Bus stops close to the hotel. Best 5 days holiday in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Complete unsatisfactory !!”
Reviews.Author: fungshuiwai
Reviews.Content: I arrived ibis singapore novena at 15:30 10/04/2011 and request for checking-in. The counter staff told me that they didn't have clean room right now. They told us to keep our luggage at the counter and go out for a walk. I asked him how about if came back 30mins later. He reply me that they need at least one hour to clean the room. Their check-in policy was 14:00. How comes they can talk to me like this and without a sorry. Then, we return at 16:30. They gave us a room finally but it was at end of corridor just adjacent to fire escape. When we go inside, we found that the windows was facing a building under construction. I requested for a change. They gave us another room on the other side not facing the building under construction. Then, I ask the manager why you didn't give us that room in the first place. He said I didn't request a quite room in the first place and the computer arrange a room automatically.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Suprise”
Reviews.Author: rcj957
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights just after opening,check in was friendly and efficient service on arrival, rooms are small but this is compensated by the huge window outlook.Great value for money Large firm double bed,Flat screen tv,free wireless internet in your room,room was well insulated and quiet and of course bieng new spotless thru out.breakfast included was good .I was able to walk to Novena mrt comfortably in 6/8 minutes Novena mrt is only 2 stops to Orchard road (Somerset mrt) taxi to the Airport @S$20. Because it is a new hotel some taxi drivers do not know it yet! final verdict ......will stay there again soon highly recommended staff were helpful for aussies they are just installing Australian channel on tv so you can keep up to date with news from home.

Reviews.Title: “too new to handle customers..”
Reviews.Author: tree5
Reviews.Content: First impression: Nice and cosy hotel, but a long (10 mins) & sloopy hill walk from Novena MRT station. Second Day: Window was left open after room make-up. Called to complain and was told "we will investigate" yet never come back to me again! Second Night: Drilling and renovation work still on going at 12am! called 3 times to reception before the annoying work stopped. However, was disappointed as never get an explanation from Management AGAIN on what's going on.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills, Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: charlierao Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Just checked-in and this is my first impression. My cabbie went around the hotel trying to figure out a convenient spot where the hotel staff could see me and help me with my luggage, as I had more bags than I could handle. Once I dragged my bags into the reception area, I was immediately attended to by the receptionist, Brenda. Check-in was smooth. Rooms are small, very basic, but well-designed, with a work desk, an LCD TV, and tea/coffee making facilities, a locker, and an excellent wi-fi connection. Since the hotel has been newly opened, all towels and sheets and sparkling white. Bathroom is pretty small, but functional. The hotel is right next to a construction site, but my room was surprisingly quite. Lots of little eateries next door and restaurants further down Balestier Road, within the Balestier Plaza mall and a cinema at Shaw Plaza. Taxis are easily available and there's a bus stop right next to the hotel. The Novena MRT is a 10 min stroll away. Overall a nice, pleasant hotel, though I will reserve my final word on housekeeping and other services for review after a couple of nights' stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy, ...just practical”
Reviews.Author: Rustyute
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on a corner - quiet Irrawaddy Road that becomes an easy walk to Novena MRT in 10 minutes. The other road in busy Balestier Road and is ideal to hail a cab or grab a bus. The hotel has a very open, ground floor dining area with huge windows that face directly onto both roads. Great to be part of the streetscape, and be in air-con comfort. My daughter and I shared a room – it was smallish and only just adequate. The bathroom has a shower, toilet and a corner wash basin only – all a bit too compact for two. There was a convenient desk type area if you have office work to do. The wireless internet connection operates through all rooms from what I understand, it was very easy to access and operated seamlessly. I think the hotel could work well for business types. Not fancy, …just practical. We arrived on opening day, …yep, it was all brand new! (Just loved the smell of freshly painted walls in the crowded reception area on check in). The hotel certainly had its share of first week jitters – like a failed motor in the exhaust system for the kitchen during dinner. All the dining area was filled with cooking smoke. To the credit of GM Shamila, she was on hand to advise the guests of what had happened and apologised profusely for the inconvenience. It was fixed the next day! There were also a number of trainees on the team in all areas of operations, some were brilliant, …and others? ...well, they needed a bit more training! The highly visible areas, like dining, seemed to worked well You could still tell there was some startup nervousness. Some of the team were a little 'over' attentive and not relaxed with how things can work well without fuss. Some of the facilities are still to come online, like the fitness centre and guest laundry. All part of the newness and getting the place operating. The management team was very visible and responsive during this 'nervous' week. Thanks GM Shamila and OM Stuart. Only real issue that you need to be aware is that the hotel prices are + +. That is the rate is advertised without inclusions for breakfast and two taxes totaling another 17%. Once the hotel gets into a steady pattern of operation and out of the startup phase it should be good for the no frills traveller.
